name: easy_header
description: Automatically insert header/author comment text into file. Easy configuration and powerful customization to fit any needs.

${npm_package_name}.üòâ.markdownDescription:
(this is not a setting)  

‚òùÔ∏è **Remember, remember,** you can always overwrite all settings in a *settings.json*, even language specific: `"[<language>]": { "${npm_package_name}.<setting>": ... }`, to achieve your desired header style üëç  

The effective setting is computed by overriding or merging the values in the following order:  

1. `defaultValue`  

1. `globalValue` (if defined ‚û°Ô∏è *User settings.json*)  

1. `workspaceValue` (if defined ‚û°Ô∏è *Workspace settings.json*)  

1. `workspaceFolderValue` (if defined ‚û°Ô∏è *.vscode/settings.json*)  

1. `globalLanguageValue` (if defined ‚û°Ô∏è *User settings.json "[<language>]": ...*)  

1. `workspaceLanguageValue` (if defined ‚û°Ô∏è *Workspace settings.json "[<language>]": ...*)

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.enable.markdownDescription: Automatically insert header from **Template** into new files.

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.allow.markdownDescription: For which *language identifiers* automatic header insert is allowed by default.

${npm_package_name}.autoInsert.languages.markdownDescription:
List of *language identifiers* for **Allow** negation.  

- If **Allow** is `all` this works as a blacklist (exclude these languages)  

- If **Allow** is `none` this works as a whitelist (auto insert only for these languages)  

‚òùÔ∏è List of [known language identifiers](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/identifiers#_known-language-identifiers)

markdownEnumDescriptions:
Use Line Comment style.  

`// Hello`  

`// World`

Insert header text as is.  

`Hello`  

`World`  

No extra commenting is done.  

Attention ‚ö†Ô∏è  

üÖ∞ Use this option as a language specific **Template** overwrite in *settings.json*, as you must use the correct comment charaters in the  **Template**:  

`"[<language>]": { "${npm_package_name}.commentMode": "raw", "${npm_package_name}.template": ... }`  

üÖ± Use the comment [vscode snippet variables](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_variables) in the **Template**:  

`${BLOCK_COMMENT_START}`  

`${BLOCK_COMMENT_END}`  

`${LINE_COMMENT}`
${npm_package_name}.commentMode.markdownDescription:
How to comment header text assembled from **Template**.  

Attention ‚ö†Ô∏è  

Not all languages support all modes; e.g. *js* both (`// /* */`), *html* / *css* only block tags (`<!-- -->` / `/* */`), *shell* however only line tag (`REM`, `#`). You can use language specific overwrites in *settings.json*: `"[shellscript]": { "${npm_package_name}.commentMode": "line" }` in these cases.

${npm_package_name}.template.markdownDescription:
Header template text or URI.  

See **Variables** for string interpolation options.  

Template examples:  

- Plain text `Author: <author>\n(c) $CURRENT_YEAR`  

- File containing template text in current workspace `file://$WORKSPACE_FOLDER/template.txt`  

- Local file `file://C:\clients\header.txt`  

- Local file `file:///home/user/header`  

- Remote `https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/vscode/snippet/snippetVariables.ts`  

‚òùÔ∏è To initiate interpolation in URI, at least one variable must contain a `$`.

${npm_package_name}.variables.markdownDescription:
Variables for interpolation in **Template** and **Content**.  

You can use all [vscode snippet variables](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/userdefinedsnippets#_variables) and define custom variable pairs here in [INI file format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/INI_file#Format) `name=value`.  

`value` is evaluated as JavaScript code before  replace(`name`), allowing for arbitrary complex text -- use quotation for string values!  

‚òùÔ∏è Interpolation is done in the order of this list (lastly vscode snippet variables); e.g. `a='b'` followed by `b='c'` would be equal to `a='c'` -- keep an eye out on not accidentally overwriting names from values.

${npm_package_name}.logLevel.markdownDescription: Minium log level to print in *Output Channel*.

${npm_package_name}.newLines.markdownDescription:
Additional *new lines* after final header line.  

Use this option instead of adding `\n` in **Template** to avoid commented out new lines.
